In 'Mama', Kim Charpentier showcases a tenacious and empowering protagonist who empowers and inspires women to stand up for themselves against bullying. The film also explores themes of self-discovery and overcoming trauma.

On the other hand, 'The Bad Seed' presents a young woman facing adversity in a male-dominated world. The film offers a suspenseful and psychological exploration of a child's struggle with bullying and abuse.
